info.title: Containarium API
info.description: Container management API for LXC-based development environments. Provides both gRPC and REST interfaces for managing containers, SSH keys, and system resources.

get.description: Returns a list of deployed applications with optional filtering by state or username.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description:
Filter by state

 - APP_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified state (should not be used)
 - APP_STATE_UPLOADING: Source code is being uploaded
 - APP_STATE_BUILDING: Docker image is being built
 - APP_STATE_RUNNING: App is running and healthy
 - APP_STATE_STOPPED: App is stopped by user
 - APP_STATE_FAILED: Build or runtime failure
 - APP_STATE_RESTARTING: App is restarting

post.description: Deploys a new application or updates an existing one. Accepts source code + Dockerfile or auto-detects language and generates Dockerfile.

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific application including state, domain, and configuration.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an application and optionally removes associated data volumes.

get.description: Returns application logs with optional streaming. Use follow=true for real-time log streaming.

post.description: Restarts an application by stopping and starting it.
Stops a running application. The application can be started again later.

get.description: Returns a list of containers with optional filtering by state, username, or labels. Use query parameters to filter results.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
Filter by state (optional, empty means all states)

 - CONTAINER_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified state (should not be used)
 - CONTAINER_STATE_RUNNING: Container is running
 - CONTAINER_STATE_STOPPED: Container is stopped
 - CONTAINER_STATE_FROZEN: Container is frozen (paused)
 - CONTAINER_STATE_CREATING: Container is being created
 - CONTAINER_STATE_ERROR: Container creation failed or is in error state

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Filter by username (optional, empty means all users)

parameters.name: labelFilter
parameters.description: Filter by labels (optional, empty means no filter)

post.description: Creates a new LXC container with specified resources and configuration. The container will be started automatically after creation.

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific container including state, resources, network info, and current metrics.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the container to get

delete.description: Permanently deletes a container. Use force=true query parameter to delete running containers.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the container to delete

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force delete even if container is running

get.description: Returns the network ACL (firewall rules) configured for a user's DevBox container.

put.description: Updates the network ACL for a DevBox container. Use a preset for common configurations or specify custom rules.

post.description: Adds an SSH public key to a container's authorized_keys file, allowing SSH access with the corresponding private key.

delete.description: Removes an SSH public key from a container's authorized_keys file, revoking SSH access for that key. The ssh_public_key should be URL-encoded.

parameters.name: sshPublicKey
parameters.description: SSH public key to remove (exact match)

post.description: Starts a stopped container. The container must exist and be in STOPPED state.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the container to start

post.description: Gracefully stops a running container with optional timeout and force parameters. The container can be started again later.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the container to stop

get.description: Returns runtime metrics (CPU, memory, disk, network usage) for containers. Specify username to get metrics for a specific container, or omit to get all containers.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the container (empty for all containers)

get.description: Returns runtime metrics (CPU, memory, disk, network usage) for containers. Specify username to get metrics for a specific container, or omit to get all containers.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the container (empty for all containers)

get.description: Returns available firewall rule presets with their default configurations.
Returns DNS records configured for the base domain. Useful for selecting available subdomains when creating routes.
Returns all DNS/domain to container mappings configured in the reverse proxy.

post.description: Creates a new DNS/domain to container mapping in the reverse proxy.

delete.description: Removes a DNS/domain to container mapping from the reverse proxy.

put.description: Updates an existing DNS/domain to container mapping.

get.description: Returns the network topology including all containers, apps, proxy routes, and their connections for visualization.
Returns information about the host system including Incus version, available resources, and container counts.

ACLAction.description:
- ACL_ACTION_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified action (should not be used)
 - ACL_ACTION_ALLOW: Allow the traffic
 - ACL_ACTION_DROP: Drop the traffic silently
 - ACL_ACTION_REJECT: Reject the traffic with ICMP response
ACLAction.title: ACLAction represents the action to take when a rule matches

ACLPreset.description:
- ACL_PRESET_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified preset
 - ACL_PRESET_FULL_ISOLATION: Full isolation: only allow HTTP from proxy, block inter-container traffic
 - ACL_PRESET_HTTP_ONLY: HTTP only: allow HTTP/HTTPS inbound, standard egress
 - ACL_PRESET_PERMISSIVE: Permissive: allow all traffic (for development)
 - ACL_PRESET_CUSTOM: Custom: user-defined rules
ACLPreset.title: ACLPreset represents predefined firewall rule sets

defaultIngressRules.title: Default ingress rules for this preset

defaultEgressRules.title: Default egress rules for this preset

action.title: Action to take when rule matches

ACLRule.title: ACLRule represents a single firewall rule

containerName.title: Optional: Associated container name (for display purposes)

AddRouteRequest.title: AddRouteRequest adds a new proxy route

AddSSHKeyBody.title: AddSSHKeyRequest is the request to add an SSH key to a container

totalKeys.title: Total number of SSH keys now authorized

AddSSHKeyResponse.title: AddSSHKeyResponse is the response from adding an SSH key

id.title: Unique app ID (UUID) - immutable primary key

containerName.title: LXC container name where app runs

errorMessage.title: Error message if state is FAILED

aclPreset.title: Firewall ACL preset applied to this app

AppResources.title: AppResources defines resource limits for an app container

AppState.description:
- APP_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified state (should not be used)
 - APP_STATE_UPLOADING: Source code is being uploaded
 - APP_STATE_BUILDING: Docker image is being built
 - APP_STATE_RUNNING: App is running and healthy
 - APP_STATE_STOPPED: App is stopped by user
 - APP_STATE_FAILED: Build or runtime failure
 - APP_STATE_RESTARTING: App is restarting
AppState.title: AppState represents the lifecycle state of an application

resources.title: Resource limits applied to this container

sshKeys.title: SSH public keys authorized for this container

createdAt.title: Unix timestamp when container was created

updatedAt.title: Unix timestamp when container was last updated

labels.title: Custom labels for categorization and metadata

image.title: Image used to create the container (e.g., "images:ubuntu/24.04")

Container.title: Container represents a complete container instance

cpuUsageSeconds.title: CPU usage in seconds (cumulative CPU time used)

networkRxBytes.title: Network bytes received (all interfaces except loopback)

networkTxBytes.title: Network bytes transmitted (all interfaces except loopback)

processCount.title: Number of running processes in container

ContainerMetrics.title: ContainerMetrics contains runtime metrics for a container

ContainerState.description:
- CONTAINER_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified state (should not be used)
 - CONTAINER_STATE_RUNNING: Container is running
 - CONTAINER_STATE_STOPPED: Container is stopped
 - CONTAINER_STATE_FROZEN: Container is frozen (paused)
 - CONTAINER_STATE_CREATING: Container is being created
 - CONTAINER_STATE_ERROR: Container creation failed or is in error state
ContainerState.title: ContainerState represents the current state of a container

resources.title: Resource limits (optional, uses defaults if not specified)

sshKeys.title: SSH public keys to authorize (optional, can be added later)

image.title: Container image to use (optional, defaults to images:ubuntu/24.04)

enableDocker.title: Enable Docker support (optional, defaults to true)

async.title:
Async mode - if true, returns immediately with CREATING state
Client should poll GetContainer to check completion

staticIp.title:
Static IP address to assign (optional, e.g., "10.0.3.100")
Must be within the container network CIDR (e.g., 10.0.3.0/24)
If empty, DHCP will assign an IP automatically

CreateContainerRequest.title: CreateContainerRequest is the request to create a new container

sshCommand.title: SSH connection string for the user

CreateContainerResponse.title: CreateContainerResponse is the response from creating a container

data.title: Record data (IP address for A records)

DeleteContainerResponse.title: DeleteContainerResponse is the response from deleting a container

DeployAppRequest.title: DeployAppRequest deploys a new app or updates existing

GetContainerResponse.title: GetContainerResponse is the response from getting a container

GetMetricsResponse.title: GetMetricsResponse is the response from getting metrics

GetSystemInfoResponse.title: GetSystemInfoResponse is the response from getting system information

containers.title: List of containers matching the filter criteria

ListContainersResponse.title: ListContainersResponse is the response from listing containers

preset.title: Preset type (if using a predefined rule set)

NetworkACL.title: NetworkACL represents firewall rules for a container/app

NetworkEdge.title: NetworkEdge represents a connection between nodes

ipAddress.title: Primary IP address assigned to the container

macAddress.title: MAC address of the container's network interface

NetworkInfo.title: NetworkInfo contains network configuration for a container

NetworkNode.title: NetworkNode represents a node in the network topology

NetworkTopology.title: NetworkTopology represents the complete network visualization

ProxyRoute.title: ProxyRoute represents a DNS/domain to container mapping

totalKeys.title: Total number of SSH keys remaining

RemoveSSHKeyResponse.title: RemoveSSHKeyResponse is the response from removing an SSH key

ResourceLimits.title: ResourceLimits defines resource constraints for a container

StartContainerBody.title: StartContainerRequest is the request to start a container

StartContainerResponse.title: StartContainerResponse is the response from starting a container

force.title: Force stop (kill) instead of graceful shutdown

timeout.title: Timeout in seconds for graceful shutdown (default: 30)

StopContainerBody.title: StopContainerRequest is the request to stop a container

StopContainerResponse.title: StopContainerResponse is the response from stopping a container

SystemInfo.title: SystemInfo contains information about the host system

preset.title: Use a preset (mutually exclusive with custom rules)

ingressRules.title: Custom ingress rules (only if preset is CUSTOM)

egressRules.title: Custom egress rules (only if preset is CUSTOM)

UpdateContainerACLBody.title: UpdateContainerACLRequest updates firewall rules for a DevBox container

UpdateRouteBody.title: UpdateRouteRequest updates an existing proxy route
